content.description:
Test

Layout Map of Great Zimbabwe

The map shows the following features from north to south and east to west:

Eastern (Sacred) Enclosure

Outspan Ruins and Inner Perimeter Wall

The Ridge, The Valley, and East Ruins

The Great Enclosure

A large, stonewalled settlement, Great Zimbabwe was once a political and urban center.
content.question: Which of the following claims can best be supported by the map?

choices.label: The Shona people constructed a sophisticated settlement.
The merchants of the Swahili Coast became wealthy from trade.
The people of Kongo practiced a complex syncretic religion.
The Nok society developed an advanced artistic tradition.

content.answer: The Shona people constructed a sophisticated settlement.

topic.text: 1.9: West Central Africa: The Kingdom of Kongo
